original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields steady after unchanged policy rates, rupee flat
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee opened slightly weaker at 302.55/60 to the US dollar on Wednesday, from 302.45/60 the previous day, while bond yields were broadly steady, dealers said.
The central bank said it kept its policy rate unchanged at 7.75 percent, saying the stance will support steering inflation towards the target of 5 percent and help to expand the economic growth.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2026 was quoted at 8.25/35 percent, down from 8.28/33 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted flat at 8.65/75 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2028 was quoted at 9.00/9.05 percent, down from 9.05/15 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2030 was quoted at 9.70/75 percent, up from 9.68/75 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2032 was quoted at 10.40/50 percent, up from 10.42/48 percent.
An auction of Rs. 38,000 million Treasury bills was ongoing.

The telegraphic transfer rates for the American dollar was 299.0000 buying, 306.0000 selling; the British pound was 403.0983 buying, and 414.4601 selling, and the euro was 350.6526 buying, 362.0158 selling.
The Colombo Stocks Exchange was trading in green; The ASPI was up 0.36 percent, or 77.61 points, at 21,360; the S&P SL20 was up 0.38 percent, or 22.99 points, at 6,096.(Colombo/Sep24/2025)
